E	Online purchases can take taxes away from the local economy.	In 2012, Indiana lost $195 million in sales tax revenue to online purchases, according to the University of Tennessee.	109_9
E	Online purchases can take taxes away from the local economy.	This number is almost certainly larger now that the popularity of online sales has skyrocketed.	109_9
O	Online purchases can take taxes away from the local economy.	In an attempt to reduce these losses, Indiana passed a law in 2017, that went into effect in October of 2018, that requires retailers that earn at least $100,000 in sales in Indiana or that serve at least 200 Indiana residents in a year to charge sales taxes on online purchases.	109_9
O	Online purchases can take taxes away from the local economy.	This law, however, does not affect smaller businesses.	109_9

Historically, support for modern multiculturalism stems from the changes in Western societies after World War II, in what Susanne Wessendorf calls the human rights revolution, in which the horrors of institutionalized racism and ethnic cleansing became almost impossible to ignore in the wake of the Holocaust; with the collapse of the European colonial system, as colonized nations in Africa and Asia successfully fought for their independence and pointed out the discriminatory underpinnings of the colonial system; and, in the United States in particular, with the rise of the Civil Rights Movement, which criticized ideals of assimilation that often led to prejudices against those who did not act according to Anglo-American standards and which led to the development of academic ethnic studies programs as a way to counteract the neglect of contributions by racial minorities in classrooms [ref].	117_1

O	Wind farms may affect weather in their immediate vicinity.	The numbers of bats killed by existing onshore and near-shore facilities have troubled bat enthusiasts [ref].	121_2
O	Wind farms may affect weather in their immediate vicinity.	In April 2009 the Bats and Wind Energy Cooperative released initial study results showing a 73% drop in bat fatalities when wind farm operations are stopped during low wind conditions, when bats are most active [ref].	121_2
O	Wind farms may affect weather in their immediate vicinity.	Bats avoid radar transmitters, and placing microwave transmitters on wind turbine towers may reduce the number of bat collisions [ref].	121_2
O	Wind farms may affect weather in their immediate vicinity.	It is hypothesized that a portion of bat fatalities are attributed to the wind displacement caused by the wind turbine blades as they move through the air causing insects in the area to become disoriented making it a dense area of prey - an attractive hunting ground for bats [ref].	121_2
O	Wind farms may affect weather in their immediate vicinity.	To combat this phenomenon ultrasonic deterrents have been tested on select wind turbines and has been shown to reduce bat fatalities from collision and barotrauma [ref].	121_2
O	Wind farms may affect weather in their immediate vicinity.	Testing of the ultrasonic deterrents has shown significantly reduced bat activity around wind turbines; according to study done in Zzyzyx, California, bat activity was reduced by 89.6-97.5% when ultrasonic acoustic deterrents were used [ref].	121_2
O	Wind farms may affect weather in their immediate vicinity.	A 2013 study produced an estimate that wind turbines killed more than 600,000 bats in the U.S. the previous year, with the greatest mortality occurring in the Appalachian Mountains.	121_2
O	Wind farms may affect weather in their immediate vicinity.	Some earlier studies had produced estimates of between 33,000 and 888,000 bat deaths per year [ref].	121_2

O	Wind farms tend to have much less impact on the environment than many other power stations.	Wind farm	121_5
O	Wind farms tend to have much less impact on the environment than many other power stations.	A wind farm or wind park, also called a wind power station or wind power plant [ref], is a group of wind turbines in the same location used to produce electricity.	121_5
O	Wind farms tend to have much less impact on the environment than many other power stations.	Wind farms vary in size from a small number of turbines to several hundred wind turbines covering an extensive area.	121_5
O	Wind farms tend to have much less impact on the environment than many other power stations.	Wind farms can be either onshore or offshore.	121_5
O	Wind farms tend to have much less impact on the environment than many other power stations.	Many of the largest operational onshore wind farms are located in China, India, and the United States.	121_5
O	Wind farms tend to have much less impact on the environment than many other power stations.	For example, the largest wind farm in the world, Gansu Wind Farm in China had a capacity of over 6,000 MW by 2012 [ref], with a goal of 20,000 MW[3] by 2020 [ref].	121_5
O	Wind farms tend to have much less impact on the environment than many other power stations.	As of September 2018, the 659 MW Walney Wind Farm in the UK is the largest offshore wind farm in the world [ref].	121_5
O	Wind farms tend to have much less impact on the environment than many other power stations.	Individual wind turbine designs continue to increase in power, resulting in fewer turbines being needed for the same total output.	121_5
E	Wind farms tend to have much less impact on the environment than many other power stations.	Wind farms tend to have much less impact on the environment than many other power stations.	121_5
O	Wind farms tend to have much less impact on the environment than many other power stations.	Onshore wind farms are also criticized for their visual impact and impact on the landscape, as typically they need to take up more land than other power stations and need to be built in wild and rural areas, which can lead to industrialization of the countryside, habitat loss, and a drop in tourism.	121_5
O	Wind farms tend to have much less impact on the environment than many other power stations.	Critics have linked wind farms to adverse health effects (see wind turbine syndrome).	121_5
O	Wind farms tend to have much less impact on the environment than many other power stations.	Wind farms have also been criticized for interfering with radar, radio and television reception [ref].	121_5

There have been multiple scientific, peer-reviewed studies into wind farm noise, which have concluded that infrasound from wind farms is not a hazard to human health and there is no verifiable evidence for 'Wind Turbine Syndrome' causing Vibroacoustic disease, although some suggest further research might still be useful [ref].	121_5
